rComments: Professor does not grade heavily on your grade percentage but give students a rough grade of how he thinks they are doing in his class so class participation really counts at the end. He is unfair when it comes to grading. Class is offered once a year so failing it will delay your graduation by one year. Does not follow his syllabus grading format.

Dr. Polyzotis is one of the best professors at UCSC.  If you are just looking to fulfill a requirement, his classes are not for you.  If you want to significantly enhance your knowledge about databases, you will find no better opportunity.  He is very organized, fair, and friendly.  Reading the text was easy after attending his lectures.

Great teacher, as previously mentioned a bit dry in presentation but very knowledgable. Fair and curves so grades turn out okay. Very challenging assignments and tests, you will have to work but you will learn A LOT. Definitely recommended.

He's extemely skilled in DB technologies. His lectures might lack zest or spice but they present great insight and are worth attending. Labs might be hard but he cares a lot about your understanding so visit him as often as possible if you don't feel comfortable with certain concepts. He's another great European asset in the CS department.
Good teacher.  Sometimes a bit dry but very knowledgable and was able to teach.  Lab assignemt was extremely difficult but I learned a LOT.

Knows his material but pretty boring. Pretty decent at presenting material. Lab assignments were challenging but not too hard, homework was fair, midterm/final were pretty hard (the people who were doing well got a D+/C- on midterm). Scales grades accordingly at the end so it tends to work out okay.
